definition: guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Guo

sentences.english: At least the banks would not be holding the whole country hostage.
sentences.chinese: 至少銀行就不能打着保家衛國的旗號，發國難財了。

sentences.english: Your charge now is not only to protect our country, but to do what is right and just.
sentences.chinese: 你們的使命不僅是保家衛國，更是伸張正義。

sentences.english: They made a promise to our country to be its defenders.
sentences.chinese: 他們在保家衛國上做出許諾。

sentences.english: Women now have the ability to fight crime and defend their countries in war.
sentences.chinese: 女性如今有能力打擊犯罪，更能在戰時保家衛國。

sentences.english: This is what the military leaders, charged with responsibility for our strategic  deterrent, need in order to defend our country.
sentences.chinese: 這是肩負戰略威懾職責的軍事領袖們保家衛國的需要。

sentences.english: His hearth difficult, Kings son and the son of the people also get on the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 保家衛國難啊，帝王之子和百姓之子也得上戰場。

sentences.english: This is what the military leaders, charged with responsibility for our strategic deterrent, need in order to defend our country.
sentences.chinese: 這是肩負戰略威懾職責的軍事領袖們保家衛國的需要。

sentences.english: Historically kungfu was used to fight one's enemies and protect the homeland.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上，功夫主要用來與敵人鬥爭，保家衛國。

sentences.english: They mold you for your future roles as the custodians of the Nation's defense.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲了塑造你將來爲保家衛國的守衛者角色。

definition: glorious achievement (idiom)
to sacrifice one's life
to attack the enemy
to resist the enemy
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
fight
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to love Hong Kong (usually implying that one also supports the PRC government)
to take revenge for a past insult/to expunge a disgrace or humiliation
to help the dying and heal the injured
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
army-civilian/military-masses/military-civilian
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
